project_name: The impact of AI in the process of empathy
description: Exploring the implications of GPT-3.5 and Midjourney in UX research

About.title: About
About.text: With the new development of the AI tools, more and more young researchers are starting to use them in various parts of their process. But they do not have the experience to know what is right and what is not in a process thus leaving them vulnerable to the biases of such tools.

Challenge.title: Challenge
Challenge.text: Map out the first impacts that AI tools such as GPT 3.5 and Midjourney have on the process of empathy development in UX designers

Solution.title: Solution
Solution.text: To tackle ths challenge I conducted a two phased research with the first part being focused on an explorative approach on the usage of AI in research. The 2nd phase was focused on an experiment that explored levels of empathy in UX researchers that used AI tools compared to traditional methods.

Desk research.title: Desk research
Desk research.text: The first step in my research project was to explore the existing literature on the subject. To organize the pool of articles, podcasts, research papers, I created a system where I would select the most interesting materials and summarize them and  use them as references or inspiration. I chose to conduct desk research because itâ€™s important to explore the existing literature before starting a complex project. First of all to identify leads, then to understand what was already in the field.

Focus.title: Focus
Focus.text: While conducting the desk research I came to the conclusion that my topic was not explored almoust at all. While tens of research papers were posted everyday focused on AI technology in multiple fields, there was very little information talking about both empathy and AI in the same place. Thus my goal for the desk research :
Focus.focus: Explore and identify the specific use cases in which young UX researchers are using Ai tools and define their reasons, goals, approaches. Then, compare how much empathy they have with their target group when using AI compared to traditional research methods

RQ.text: After the desk research gave me a couple of directions and ideas about the project, I created two research questions that tackle two aspects of my goal
RQ.rq1: What are the active AI tools such as LLMs or Generative engines are used in the process of developing empathy with target groups for UX students?
RQ.rq2: What is the level of understanding of the context of a target group when conducting AI-assisted research compared to a traditional research method in the context of Human-centered design?

Phase 1.title: Phase 1
Phase 1.text: The phase 1 of the research is about the ways in which researchers are using AI tools in their process. I am looking for interesting leads, novel use cases, their successful and not so  successful experiences with these new technologies
Phase 1.targetgroup: The target group consists mostly of UX design students of the UXD course that I am also part of. The focus is placed on each of the 3 years of the programme and in some cases, professional UX Designers have been included in the study and even teachers. As the research group is focused on raising awareness inside of the course, the target group fits the context of my project.

Interviews.title: Interviews
Interviews.text: For the 2nd research method, I chose the semi-structured interview to gain an understanding of how the participants are using the AI tools and their opinions and take on those tools. The technique gives me the freedom also to ask follow-up questions and have a free conversation by deviating from the main protocol in case I find something interesting in the interview. I will also look for missing pieces in the practice like where AI can be used further and where it's not already used. Also, by listening to the needs of the researchers and getting more insights about their desires, wants and pain points, I can find out what can AI solve in the empathizing process.

Surveys.title: Surveys
Surveys.text: In this research, surveys will help me map out the use of artificial intelligence in the field of gaining empathy or research. The surveys are going to be sent to the target group and try to collect quantitative data on AI uses

AiUse.title: Ai Use
AiUse.text: The research technique of uses of AI is an edited version of content analysis for how participants have been using the tools at their disposal. Here, I am reading through the outputs of the AI tools used by the participants gathered in RM2 and RM3 and analyzing the data. At the end of each of the research methods, I asked people if they were willing to share information with me and whoever felt comfortable doing so, they did. Some people shared GPT conversations, some people shared images generated, poems, heatmaps, entire analysis processes, and multiple other things.

Experiment.title: Experiment
Experiment.text: Research method 5, the experiment, is an experiment in which I simulate a research process conducted with and without AI. With a more scientific approach, I am comparing the behaviours and level of empathy of researchers who have used AI and researchers who have used a real target group for the same research method (a controlled interview).

Analysis.title: Analysis
Analysis.text-a: For the data analysis of the 1st phase of research, I coded the interviews of the RM2 (semi-structured interviews) and proceeded to analyze the co-occurrence of the codes and their frequency of appearance. Moreover, I proceeded to create data cards for each of the interviews. For RM3 (survey) I analyzed the results and validated them with the coding results of RM2. Moreover, I also drew a conclusion based on the answers of the participants. For RM4 (Uses of AI Analysis) I read the GPt conversations and I looked through the questions they were asking and the answers. I proceeded to validate the RM2 results with RM4.
Analysis.text-b: I chose the method of coding interviews and analyzing the codes because this gave me a higher chance to identify patterns than if I did data cards, as the already created data cards are high in number and clustering and trying to identify patterns would have taken too much time.
Analysis.text-phase2: For the data analysis of the 2nd technique, I created data cards from the CTRL group, the interview made by the researcher, and concluded how many of the questions from the protocol have been answered. Moreover, I analyzed the interviews and watched the recordings to gather data on body language and the data gathered from participants. These observations were noted in a separate section from the data cards from the interviews. On the other hand, I read the GPT conversations and took out data cards from them to answer the questions from the protocol and further follow-up questions.

description: Communicating the energy transition to the people of Delft
Designing a tool for researchers to communicate with their target group
Creating a portable DJ set concept using arduino
